thread.title: VOLLEYBALL SECTIONAL DRAW: Pioneers to start 3A sectional against Brownstown
thread.title_full: VOLLEYBALL SECTIONAL DRAW: Pioneers to start 3A sectional against Brownstown

author: kevin.harris@newsandtribune.com(Kevin Harris)
title: VOLLEYBALL SECTIONAL DRAW: Pioneers to start 3A sectional against Brownstown
text: by Kevin Harris Two-time defending Class 2A state champion Providence and defending Class A state runner-up Christian Academy will each play first-round matches to begin their quest to return to the IHSAA State Finals at Worthen Arena in Muncie. The Pioneers, who moved up to Class 3A this year because of the IHSAAâ€™s success-factor rule, the Warriors and the rest of the Clark-Floyd area teams found out the routes they must take to win a sectional championship Monday as the IHSAA conducted its state tournament draw in Indianapolis. CLASS 4A JENNINGS COUNTY SECTIONAL New Albany will play in the sectional opener at 6 p.m. Thursday, Oct. 22 against Hoosier Hills Conference rival  . The second first-round match that night will be at approximately 7:30 as Jeffersonville takes on host Jennings County. The winners of both first-round matches   semifinals at 11 a.m. Saturday, Oct. 24. The second semifinal that day will pit   Floyd Central against Seymour at about 12:30 p.m. The championship match is scheduled for 7 p.m. on Oct. 24. CLASS 3A CHARLESTOWN SECTIONAL Class 3A No. 8 Silver Creek will face host Charlestown in the sectional opener at 7 p.m. next Tuesday. The winner of that opening-round match will face Mid-  Corydon Central, which got a first-round bye, at 11 a.m. Oct. 24. The Dragons are the defending sectional champions. Class 3A No. 2 Providence will start its quest for a third straight state championship and its first in 3A in the third first-round match at approximately 7:30 p.m. Oct. 22 versus Brownstown Central. It will be preceded at 6 p.m. that day by Scottsburg against Salem. The Oct. 22 victors will meet in the second semifinal at about 12:30 p.m. Oct. 24. The championship match will be later that evening at 7. CLASS 2A CLARKSVILLE SECTIONAL Host Clarksville will kick off its sectional at 7 p.m. Oct. 22 versus Paoli in the lone first-round match of the tournament. The winner will square off against Class 2A No. 9 Henryville in the second semifinal at approximately 12:30 p.m. Oct. 24. The first semi will be at 11 a.m. on the 24th between Eastern and Crawford County. The title match will take place at 7 later that night. CLASS A CHRISTIAN ACADEMY SECTIONAL The Class A No. 2 Warriors will play in the sectional opener at 6 p.m. on the 22nd versus Lanesville. The second first-round match that night will have Rock Creek taking on Madison Shawe at about 7:30. The opening-round victors will meet in the first semi at 10 a.m. Oct. 24, followed by New Washington against South Central in the second semifinal at approximately 11:30 a.m. The championship match is slated for 7 p.m. on the 24th. CLASS A ORLEANS SECTIONAL Borden will play on the first night of its new sectional. The Braves will face Southern Athletic Conference rival Crothersville in the sectional opener at 6 p.m. Oct. 22. The second first-round game will be at about 7:30 that night, as West Washington faces Class A No. 8 Trinity Lutheran. The opening-round winners   Oct. 24 first semifinal at 11 a.m. The second semifinal will take place at approximately 12:30 p.m. that day with Orleans facing Medora. The title match will be that evening at 7. CLASS 4A JENNINGS COUNTY SECTIONAL FIRST ROUND   vs. New Albany, 6 p.m. Jennings County vs. Jeffersonville, 7:30 p.m. SEMIFINALS
